meta.hint: Some verbs tell you about something that has already happened.  These verbs tell you about the past. They usually end in -ed. eg. We walked to the park yesterday. eg. We looked at the flowers there.  Some verbs are irregular in the past tense. These verbs change their  spelling to tell you about the past. You have to remember what spelling  to use. eg. We saw some ducks at the park. (See -> Saw) eg. We ate lunch on the grass. (Eat -> Ate)
